result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Lee Brando Duke

Defendant Michael Lee Brando Duke appeared by video.  Attorney Adam Joseph Kachelski appeared by video for Michael Lee Brando Duke.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense requested a plea and sentencing hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Lee Brando Duke appeared by video.  Attorney Adam Joseph Kachelski appeared by video for Michael Lee Brando Duke.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Status conference held.  Atty. Kachelski requests one more status date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received. Court finds the request for substitution was made timely.  
Court consented to substitution against Judge Watts.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Davila, Br. 19. Matter adjourned for a status in Br. 01.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court to address on the next date.  bm

Defendant Michael Lee Brando Duke in court with attorney Adam Joseph Kachelski.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael Lee Brando Duke in court with attorney Adam Joseph Kachelski.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Defense advises the court he anticipate filing a motion. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
This hearing will held Remotely streamed Live through dacast - Via Zoom. Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Amount: $20.00
Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Z.S.G. and P.M.G.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Lee Brando Duke in court.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant DECLINED to be interviewed by the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/02/2022@02:00pm
